Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown-coloured ribbed pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a copy of an epitaph.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.78-79)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372012) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372012)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Pamoun of Terfshô
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 64 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
